lead_paragraph: The University of Louisville will trade in historic but outdated Freedom Hall for a new downtown facility, a 22,000-seat arena that will open in 2010. The university’s board of trustees and athletic association’s board approved the outline of a deal between the university and the Louisville Arena Authority over the $381 million project. The authority reached an agreement with Louisville Gas and Electric on a $71.3 million deal that will pay for the land and move a transmission station from where the arena will be built.
